attributes.action: Allow the Clacton Constituency voters a chance to change their MP under Recall
attributes.additional_details: Electorate:  67,447 (December 2010).  Thus if 7000 of Clacton's voters support this petition, Douglas Carswell, as somebody who has repeatedly claimed that MPs should honourably stand down and seek re-election if they leave their party but now appears to be hiding behind the fact that he is not 'crossing the floor', should respect their wishes, stand down and allow a by-election to take place.
attributes.background: Under MP Recall proposals (2014) it was agreed that MPs should be recalled if 10% of their electorate voted that their MP should stand down.  Many of Clacton's electorate voted for the party, not the man and so should be given the opportunity to select a new MP following his resignation from UKIP.

rejection.details:
If you'd like the law on the recall of MPs to be changed, you may wish to sign this petition instead:
